Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: "Love: Beyond the Rage and Beyond the Terror", which follows his love life and introduction, and "On the Childhood Chicago Love", which is a comedic take on the beloved teen slice-of-life-esque style that was prominent in the writer's works.

This movie deals with the European ERASMUS exchange program but more generally about the European youth. It is so true, that I don't know Klapischan's work but she is a very gifted director.
The plot : A group of young liberal Iranian students, disgusted by the hypocrite theocratic ideology of their government, try to run away. They want to leave Iran for Europe. But their many problems (with money, passports, police, ...) make things complicated.
